page.title: 02ON THE EDGE OF LYMM
page.content: The area to the South of Lymm is very rural. From here to the outskirts of Grappenhall to the west are miles of neat, tidy farms, both dairy farms and arable farms. The arable farms grow mainly barley, though wheat is important with some fields of potatoes being apparent. The farm houses look well to do, being substantial houses rather than small cottages. There is much woodland in this pleasant undulating land south of the River Mersey. It is hard to believe that you are only 3 miles fron the industrial town of Warrington, but the M6, which disects the area in the form of the Thelwall Viaduct is a clear reminder. On a clear day looking North from the A5O bridge over the M6 Warrington can be clearly seen with white smoke from Lever Brothers.
